episodeTitle: Frantic Struggle! Wetton's Plans and the Rainbow Tower!
episodeTitleJapanese: 乱戦必至！ウエットンの野望と虹の塔
episodeTitleRomanized: Ransen hissu! Uetton no yabō to niji no tō
episodeTitleAlternate: An Inevitable Melee! Wetton's Schemes and the Rainbow Tower!
description: Luffy and Rapanui journey through the Rainbow Mist while Nami discovers treasure in a ship graveyard. Wetton activates the Rainbow Tower to create a bridge into the mist, launching his invasion to steal the treasures of Ape's Concert.

events.title: Ian Tricks Akibi
events.description: In a Marine wreckage cell, Ian successfully tricks the gullible Akibi into releasing him from his confinement. Ian then discovers that Wetton has already progressed into his third generation.
events.significance: Establishes Ian's cunning nature and shows Wetton's continued presence as a threat across generations.

events.title: Nami Discovers Ship Graveyard Treasure
events.description: Nami appears in the ship graveyard section of Ape's Concert with a rowboat full of treasure. While she appreciates the riches, she realizes they are useless if they cannot escape the Rainbow Mist.
events.significance: Highlights the paradox of Ape's Concert - filled with treasures but impossible to escape, and shows Nami's practical thinking despite her love of treasure.

events.title: Usopp Challenges Nami as Navigator
events.description: Usopp tells Nami that as the crew's navigator, she should find a way to escape the Rainbow Mist. This puts pressure on Nami to use her skills to solve their predicament.
events.significance: Demonstrates crew dynamics and Nami's role as navigator, even in supernatural situations.

events.title: Rapanui Sees His Father's Ship
events.description: While tired from walking with Luffy, Rapanui spots what appears to be his father on a Marine ship within the Rainbow Mist, before seeing a light and getting splashed by water as the Rainbow Tower is knocked down.
events.significance: Reveals the tragic fate of Rapanui's father who was trapped in the Rainbow Mist while searching for it, deepening the emotional stakes of the arc.

events.title: Rainbow Tower Activation
events.description: The Mayor Wetton uses the Rainbow Tower to create a bridge to the Rainbow Mist. The tower extends horizontally straight into the mist, creating a tunnel-like conveyor belt for entry.
events.significance: This is the culmination of Wetton's scheme - the Rainbow Tower's true purpose is revealed as a method to access and plunder Ape's Concert.

events.title: Rainbow Mist Waters Turn Rough
events.description: The sea inside the Rainbow Mist becomes turbulent as Henzo observes the Rainbow Tower extending into Ape's Concert. The dimensional stability is being disrupted.
events.significance: Shows the dangerous consequences of forcibly opening the Rainbow Mist dimension.

events.title: Rapanui's Emotional Confrontation with Henzo
events.description: Rapanui pushes Henzo, initially refusing to believe he's the real Henzo, and reminds him of Wetton's burning of their village. Usopp defends Henzo, explaining that he endured many backstabs while researching the Rainbow Mist to save them.
events.significance: Reveals the depth of Henzo's sacrifice and dedication to his childhood friends over 50 years, and shows Rapanui beginning to accept the time displacement.

events.title: Rapanui Realizes 50 Years Have Passed
events.description: Unable to punch Henzo, Rapanui breaks down crying as he finally accepts that 50 years have truly passed while they were trapped in the Rainbow Mist.
events.significance: This emotional moment represents Rapanui accepting the impossible reality of time displacement and the sacrifice his friend made.

events.title: Wetton's Forces Invade Ape's Concert
events.description: Rapanui and Luffy return to the group, realizing that Wetton is invading Ape's Concert. Guards arrive through the Rainbow Tower's tunnel-like conveyor belt, and Wetton orders them to seize all of Ape's Concert's treasures.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the final conflict of the arc as Wetton's plan comes to fruition.

events.title: Lake Uses Dragon Spark
events.description: Lake demonstrates his Dragon Spark technique, catching opponents with both rods of his Electric Suit and severely electrocuting them with electrical current traversing between the rods.
events.significance: Showcases Lake's primary combat ability and his reliance on his Electric Suit technology.

events.title: Wetton Uses Silver Barbecue
events.description: Wetton demonstrates his Silver Barbecue technique using his Flame Suit, shooting flames at incapacitated targets.
events.significance: Reveals Wetton's reliance on mecha technology for combat despite his age.

events.title: Lake Electrocutes Sanji
events.description: When Sanji attempts to kick Wetton, Lake intervenes and electrocutes Sanji with his Electric Suit, protecting his grandfather.
events.significance: Demonstrates Lake's loyalty to Wetton and the effectiveness of his electrical abilities.

events.title: Wetton Forces Chopper to Use Rumble Ball
events.description: Under pressure from Wetton's forces, Chopper is forced to eat a Rumble Ball to enhance his Devil Fruit abilities, but still fails to overcome Lake's electric attacks.
events.significance: Shows the desperation of the Straw Hats' situation and the power of Lake's technology.

events.title: Ian Learns of Wetton's Third Generation
events.description: Ian discovers that Wetton has already entered his third generation, with his son Flip and grandson Lake continuing his legacy.
events.significance: Reveals the generational nature of Wetton's influence and how his schemes span multiple generations.

quotes.text: You should do something, you're the navigator!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Challenging Nami to find a way out of the Rainbow Mist

quotes.speaker: Rapanui Pasqua
quotes.context: Breaking down as he realizes the truth about time displacement

themes.description: The episode explores the devastating effects of time displacement, as Rapanui must accept that 50 years have passed while he remained unchanged in the Rainbow Mist.
themes.symbolism: The Rainbow Mist represents both preservation and imprisonment - the children remain young but lose their connection to their time.

themes.description: Henzo's 50-year dedication to researching the Rainbow Mist, even working for Wetton, demonstrates extreme loyalty to childhood friends.
themes.symbolism: The Rainbow Tower represents Henzo's bridge between past and present, built through decades of patience.

themes.description: Wetton's scheme to exploit the Rainbow Mist for treasure mirrors his exploitation of Ruluka Island through excessive taxation.
themes.symbolism: Ape's Concert as a ship graveyard full of treasure represents the fatal attraction of greed.

characterSpotlights.development: Rapanui confronts the reality of time displacement and must reconcile with Henzo after 50 years of separation.
keyActions: Sees vision of his father's ship in the mist
Confronts Henzo about Wetton's village burning
Breaks down crying realizing 50 years have passed
Returns with Luffy to face Wetton's invasion

characterSpotlights.development: Wetton's plan comes to fruition as the Rainbow Tower successfully creates a bridge to Ape's Concert.
keyActions: Creates bridge into the Rainbow Mist
Orders forces to invade Ape's Concert

characterSpotlights.development: Henzo's decades of sacrifice and research are revealed, showing his unwavering dedication to his childhood friends.
keyActions: His 50 years of research is explained by Usopp

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy accompanies Rapanui through the Rainbow Mist, providing companionship during the journey.
keyActions: Walks with tired Rapanui through the mist

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ruluka Island Arc is anime-only filler and does not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on January 26, 2003 in Japan, positioned between the Arabasta Arc and the Jaya Arc in the anime timeline.
The Ruluka Island Arc was the last arc dubbed by 4Kids Entertainment before they lost the One Piece license.

sources.title: Ruluka Island Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode achieved a 14.0% TV rating in Japan, ranking 5th for its time slot.
The name 'Ape's Concert' is a pun - the Japanese pronunciation of 'Sargasso' sounds similar to 'saru gassō' meaning 'monkey/ape concert'.
This episode creates a continuity issue with the later Wano Country Arc, where characters express surprise at time travel despite the Straw Hats encountering time-displaced individuals here.

sources.title: Ruluka Island Arc - One Piece Wiki
